QW_BP1.name: Using h1-h6 to identify headings
QW_BP1.description: It is recommended to use HTML and XHTML heading markup to provide semantic code for headings in the content

QW_BP2.name: Concise images alt text
QW_BP2.description: Image alt text attribute with more than 100 characters

QW_BP4.name: Grouped links not within a nav element
QW_BP4.description: Set of 10 or more links not grouped within a list (nav)

QW_BP5.name: Using table elements inside other table elements
QW_BP5.description: It is not recommended to use table elements inside other table elements

QW_BP6.name: title element is not too long (100 characters)
QW_BP6.description: The webpage title element shouldn't have more than 100 characters

QW_BP8.name: Headings with images should have an accessible name
QW_BP8.description: Headings with at least one image should have an accessible name

QW_BP9.name: Table element without header cells has a caption
QW_BP9.description: A table without th elements should have a caption element to describe it.

QW_BP10.name: HTML elements are used to control visual presentation of content
QW_BP10.description: No HTML elements are used to control the visual presentation of content

QW_BP11.name: Using br to make a list

QW_BP12.name: Using scope col and row
QW_BP12.description: Using scope col in the first row and scope row in the first element of each row

QW_BP13.name: Using consecutive links with the same href and one contains an image
QW_BP13.description: Using consecutive links with the same href in which one of the links contains an image

QW_BP15.name: At least one width attribute of an HTML element is expressed in absolute values
QW_BP15.description: At least one width attribute of an HTML element is expressed in absolute values

QW_BP17.name: Adding a link at the beginning of a block of repeated content to go to the end of the block
QW_BP17.description: The objective of this technique is to provide a mechanism to bypass a block of material by skipping to the end of the block.

QW_BP18.name: Using percentage values in CSS for container sizes
QW_BP18.description: The objective of this technique is to enable users to increase the size of text without having to scroll horizontally to read that text. To use this technique, an author specifies the width of text containers using percent values.

target.element: span article section nav aside hgroup header footer address p hr blockquote div h1 h2 h3 h4 h5 h6 li ul ol dd dt dl figcaption

QW_BP19.name: Landmark banner is top level
QW_BP19.description: Ensures the banner landmark is at top level

QW_BP20.name: Landmark no duplicate banner
QW_BP20.description: Ensures the document has at most one banner landmark

QW_BP21.name: Landmark no duplicate contentinfo
QW_BP21.description: Ensures the document has at most one contentinfo landmark

QW_BP22.name: Landmark has one main
QW_BP22.description: Ensures the document has a main landmark

QW_BP24.name: Lists are used correctly
QW_BP24.description: Ensures that lists are structured correctly. <ul> and <ol> must only directly contain <li>, <script> or <template> elements

QW_BP25.name: Landmark complementary is top level
QW_BP25.description: Ensures the complementary landmark or aside is at top level

QW_BP26.name: Landmark contentinfo is top level
QW_BP26.description: Ensures the contentinfo landmark is at top level

QW_BP27.name: Landmark main is top level
QW_BP27.description: Ensures the main landmark is at top level

QW_BP28.name: H1 element is used and unique
QW_BP28.description: Ensures theres is only one H1
